meanings.definition: The middle of the day; 12 o'clock in the daytime.
meanings.sent1: At noon, we all gather for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The clock struck noon, signaling the start of the lunch break.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat only wakes up at noon, ready for its midday nap.
meanings.sent4: The bustling city streets quiet down at noon, as people retreat indoors for a break.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun at noon casts sharp shadows on the ground.

meanings.definition: The time of day when the sun is highest in the sky.
meanings.sent1: The sun shines directly overhead at noon.
meanings.sent2: Plants reach for the sunlight at noon to soak up its warmth.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirp happily at noon, enjoying the peak of daylight.
meanings.sent4: At noon, the world seems to pause under the blazing sun.
meanings.sent5: The heat at noon makes everything shimmer in the distance.
